title: Statistical Computing - Assignment 1
text:
Welcome
This website contains an interactive website for Assignment 1 of Statistical Computing. Use the sidebar on the left to navigate through the different parts of the assignment.

Student Details

Name: Liam Kilian
Student ID: KLNLIA004
Date: 08 February 2026







TipHow to use this site



You can click the “Hide code” buttons within each practical to hide the underlying R syntax used for the analysis.

title: Practical 1 – Introduction to R
text:
Question 1


Hide code
data <- airquality
na_rows <- which(rowSums(is.na(data)) > 0)
na_rows


 [1]   5   6  10  11  25  26  27  32  33  34  35  36  37  39  42  43  45  46  52
[20]  53  54  55  56  57  58  59  60  61  65  72  75  83  84  96  97  98 102 103
[39] 107 115 119 150




Question 2


Hide code
library(knitr)

summary_table <- data.frame(
  Variable = c("Ozone", "Temperature"),
  Mean = c(mean(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), mean(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE)),
  SD = c(sd(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), sd(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE)),
  Min = c(min(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), min(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE)),
  Max = c(max(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), max(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE))
)

kable(summary_table, 
      digits = 2, 
      caption = "Descriptive Statistics for Ozone and Temperature",
      col.names = c("Variable", "Mean", "Std. Deviation", "Minimum", "Maximum"))



Descriptive Statistics for Ozone and Temperature

Question 3


Hide code
cars_data <- cars
Y <- cars_data$dist
X <- cbind(1, cars$speed)

beta_hat <- solve(t(X)%*%X)%*%(t(X)%*%Y)
beta_hat


           [,1]
[1,] -17.579095
[2,]   3.932409




Question 4


Hide code
model <- lm(cars_data$dist~cars_data$speed)
model$coefficients


    (Intercept) cars_data$speed 
     -17.579095        3.932409

title: Practical 2 - Questions 4 & 5
text:
Question 4


Hide code
x <- seq(-2, 2, length.out = 1000)
y <- sin(x)
plot(y~x)











Question 5


Hide code
library(car)

n <- 1000
rep <- 1000
sim <- sort(rt(n, 1))

sim_norm <- sort(rnorm(n))
envelope <- replicate(rep, sort(rnorm(n)))
lower <- apply(envelope, 1, quantile, probs = 0.025)
upper <- apply(envelope, 1, quantile, probs = 0.975)

par(mfrow=c(2, 1))
plot(sim~sim_norm, ylim = c(-10,10))
abline(0,1)
lines(sim_norm, lower)
lines(sim_norm, upper)

qqPlot(sim, envelope = 0.95, ylim = c(-5, 5))









[1]    1 1000

title: Practical 4 - Tidyverse
text:
WarningNote on Truncation



Most tables have been truncated using the head() function in the interest of readability.

title: Practical 4 - Tidyverse
text:
Question 6.1


Hide code
mult_routes <- flights %>% 
  mutate(route = paste(origin, dest, sep = "-")) %>% 
  group_by(route) %>% 
  summarise(
    num_carriers = n_distinct(carrier)
  ) %>% 
  filter(num_carriers > 1) %>%        
  arrange(desc(num_carriers))

kable(head(mult_routes))





route
num_carriers




EWR-DTW
5

5

5


JFK-SFO
5


JFK-TPA
5


LGA-ATL
5

title: Practical 4 - Tidyverse
text:
Question 6.2


Hide code
details <- 
  flights %>% 
  mutate(route = paste(origin, dest, sep = "-")) %>% 
  filter(route %in% mult_routes$route) %>% 
  left_join(airlines, by = "carrier") %>%
  summarise(
    ave_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = T),
    .by = c(carrier, route, name)
  ) %>% 
  arrange(desc(ave_delay))

kable(head(details))

title: Practical 4 - Tidyverse
text:
Question 6.3


Hide code
details_routes <- details %>% 
  summarise(
    min_delay = min(ave_delay),
    carrier_min = carrier[which.min(ave_delay)],
    
    max_delay = max(ave_delay),
    carrier_max = carrier[which.max(ave_delay)],
    
    .by = route
  )

kable(head(details_routes))

title: Practical 4 - Tidyverse
text:
Question 6.4


Hide code
worst_diff <-
  details_routes %>% 
  summarise(
    delta = max_delay - min_delay,
    .by = route
  ) %>% 
  arrange(desc(delta))

kable(head(worst_diff))

title: Practical 4 - Tidyverse
text:
Question 6.5
It seems that Expressjet had only one terribly delayed flight (as seen in table 2) from JFK to ATL and thus skews the average to that singular data point, thus leading to it becoming the worst difference


Hide code
reason <- 
  flights %>% 
  mutate(route = paste(origin, dest, sep = "-")) %>%
  filter(route == "JFK-ATL") %>% 
  summarise(
    ave_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = T),
    .by = carrier
  )  
kable(reason)





carrier
ave_delay

1.403846

reason2 <- 
  flights %>% 
  mutate(route = paste(origin, dest, sep = "-")) %>%
  filter(route == "JFK-ATL", carrier == "EV")
